abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Power
            Sector Generation and Restructuring Project for Albania is
            to achieve significant improvement in power system
            performance through: (i) priority investments to increase
            domestic thermal generation, and (ii) measures to implement
            sector reforms and institutional strengthening.  The project
            has two main components: a) a sector restructuring
            component; and b) an investment component (the MW 100
            combined cycle gas turbine Vlore thermal plant). The
            restructuring component of the project has been successfully
            implemented, laying out the framework for the establishment
            of an independent regulator and attracting private sector
            participation in distribution among other outcomes. The
            extension is necessary to ensure proper commissioning and
            trial operation of the Vlore Power Plant (VPP) as well as
            completion and testing of the permanent water intake pipe
            and all off-shore facilities. The Borrower, through its
            implementation agency, has proposed an acceptable action
            plan following on meetings with the contractor on June
            15-16, 2010. Periodic review of implementation progress will
            take place to ensure achievement of the project's
            development objectives in a sustainable way.
